reviews.review_msg: The exams are tough. Lectures and assignments are mandatory to do well on the exams. Lectures can be a bit too theoretical. Would appreciate more worked-out examples. He's a very smart professor. He has a good understanding of the material and cares if you understand. His writing on the whiteboard can be a bit unclear at times.

He seems interested in the course but is not able to deliver it well. He goes through easy material really slow and speeds up where you need time to understand. A strong background in Signal Processing and probability is needed, otherwise, you won't pass. And his notes and assignments, if are at level 1, he tests you in exams at level 10.

Could not see his handwriting.
Shaking camera and out of focus.
Only proof during lesson, don't know what the equations do.
Not good at teaching, equations and theories with unknown purpose.
Not willing to teach nor give back answers after you failed the midterm (more than half of the class failed).
All people failed and all got 30~40 marks boosted
